about.name: Geographic Data Explorer
about.description: An interactive map visualization system that lets you explore global data through natural language. Ask questions about any location and see the answers on the map.

capabilities: Show demographic and economic data as colored map regions (choropleth)
Display disaster events (earthquakes, hurricanes, volcanoes, tsunamis, tornadoes, floods, wildfires, landslides) as map overlays
Navigate to any location by name (countries, states, cities, counties)
Filter data by time period and severity
Answer questions about what data is available for any region
Provide reference information (capitals, currencies, languages, country backgrounds)

how_it_works.summary: Tell me what you want to see on the map. I need three things: WHERE (location), WHAT (data type), and WHEN (time period). I will build a data request, show you what I understood, and you confirm before it loads.
steps: You ask a question or make a request in plain language
I figure out the location, data type, and time range
I show you what I understood and ask you to confirm
The data loads onto the map as a visualization

disasters: What volcanoes have erupted near Indonesia?
un_sdg_indicators: Show SDG 3 health data for Europe
What SDG data do you have?

tips: You can ask 'what data do you have for [country]?' to see available datasets
Use the overlay selector on the left to toggle disaster layers
Zoom into a region first, then ask questions - I will use your current view as context
You can ask follow-up questions - I remember the conversation
Try 'show me [metric] for [region] [year]' for specific data requests
